III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4125 Personal possessions; money; clothing;
Section storage space.
Description (1) A licensee shall have a written policy that designates all of the
following:
(c) The method for ensuring that each resident has sufficient
clean, properly fitting, seasonal clothing.
1

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 11-26-23, Youth was walking with someone, name unknown,
that was watching him, without a coat. Youth stated that he did not
have a coat and there are many youth without coats. Youth had a
pull-on sweater in 35-degree weather.
Investigation Interviews:
The complainant was anonymous.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face, at the facility, on
November 29, 2023. Youth A said he has a “light coat” but not a
“winter coat”. Youth A asked the facility for a winter coat and did
not get one. Youth A said the facility staff gave him the coat he
currently has. Youth A’s coat was brought to me, and it is a
multiple layer winter coat.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face, at the facility, on
November 29, 2023. Youth B said he has been at Wolverine
Center for ten days and came with a winter coat. Youth B had a
winter coat on during the interview. Youth B said whenever he has
been outside or gone on outings all the youth from the facility have
coats. Youth B has never heard of a youth going without a coat
since he has been placed.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face, at the school, on
November 29, 2023. Youth C said he had a coat that the school
gave him. Youth C said he does not know when he got the coat
but that it was a “couple weeks ago”. Youth C said he had a coat
to wear over the previous weekend but refused to put it on. Youth
C said he did not know if the other youth at Wolverine Center had
coats or not. Youth C showed me his winter coat.
Clinical Director was interviewed face-to-face, at the facility,
on November 29, 2023. Clinical Director said during the winter or
cold months whenever a youth is placed at Wolverine Center, they
are provided a coat if they do not come with one. Clinical Director
said he has seen all the youth either wearing or carrying their
winter coats. Clinical Director said he has never had a youth, or a
staff report to him a youth going without a coat.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face, at the facility, on
November 29, 2023. Staff 1 said all of the youth have winter
coats however there are times when the youth will refuse to wear
their coat. Staff 1 said at intake there is a clothing inventory done
and if the youth does not have a coat one is given to them at that
2

time. Staff 1 said she has never had a youth report not having a
coat.
Director was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
November 29, 2023, and on December 12, 2023. Director said
when youth arrive during cold or winter months, they are provided
a coat if they do not have one. Director said they have a surplus of
extra coats in the incentive room that are all different sizes.
Director said if a youth arrives and requires a size that they do not
have on hand she will go to the store or have staff use petty cash
and go to the store to get the youth a coat. Director said youth are
not allowed to go outside without coats when it is cold out.
Director said Youth C was provided a coat by Wolverine Center
and has been wearing it daily. Director said the school never
contacted her nor was she aware of them asking any of the staff
about a coat for Youth C.
Program Associate was interviewed face-to-face at the school
on November 29, 2023. Program Associate said she is employed
by the school. Program Associate said Youth C was attending
school the week prior to Thanksgiving without a coat so she
requested from the several different staff that transported Youth C
in the morning to provide him with a coat. Program Associate said
Youth C was never provided a coat from Wolverine Center and
therefore she provided him a coat out of the school coat closet.
Case Manager was interviewed via telephone on December
19, 2023. Case Manager said she was responsible to transport
Youth C to school until bussing was arranged, so between
November 1, 2023, and November 14, 2023, she drove him to
school. Case Manager said the school never talked to her about
Youth C not having a winter coat. Case Manager said she does
not know the date Youth C was given a coat but does recall him
wearing a coat each morning that she drove him to school. Case
Manager said at intake if a youth does not have a coat, they will
provide them with one. Case Manager said anytime youth receive
items from a parent or caseworker those items are added to the
clothing inventory however if it is items given to them from the
facility they are not added therefore the date they provided Youth
C with a coat would not be on his inventory.
Documents Reviewed:
• Screenshots from Wolverine Center’s camera system were
reviewed of Youth C wearing his coat to the bus and off the
bus on November 13, 2023, November 14, 2023,
3

November 15, 2023, November 16, 2023, November 17,
2023, and November 21, 2023.
Tour Observation:
A tour of the facility occurred on November 29, 2023. The
incentive room had a large box of winter coats available for the
youth. There were also a few coats in the office that were
available for youth.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance with personal possessions,
money, clothing, storage space. Youth C had a coat on November
26, 2023, the facility has a surplus of winter coats and all other
youth have winter coats.
Technical Assistance:
Agency needs to update clothing inventory to include items the
facility is giving youth.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
